reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned on 27th February, 2012 from first time at Kiroseiz. Had a great time. Stayed in the old block which was really nice but bathrooms could do with a refurbishment. The best thing about this resort is definitely the staff. We were treated like kings and queens for the full time we were there. The food in the restaurant was first class where there was something for everyone. Would like to thank Emmad at the quiet pool bar who always greeted us in the morning and also Hamed for making sure our sunbeds were always ready for us. Our waiter in the restaurant was Amr who couldn't do enough to make sure we had everything we needed. At night we normally went into the Waves Bar for a couple of hours and were looked after well by Agmad. We then went down to the Saddle Bar where the karaoke was a great laugh. The resort itself is spotlessly clean due to the hard work of the cleaners and also the gardners. Didn't try the other restaurants as we were only there for a week and were quite happy with the main restaurant. Went to the Bedouin night at the hotel and was very impressed especially with the fire show. All in all this was a fab holiday and we will definitely be back next year.
reviews.title: FAB HOLIDAY

reviews.text: The hotel was better than we expected, the location is perefect not to close but still in easyreach of narmma bay and soho sq .the rooms are of a good size the food was of very good quality and the staff well what could we say nothing else but perfect . Go to the wave bar and meet abdullah the most lovliest man you could ever meet. Go to the restaurant and meet yasser and to be booked on the bedouin night is a must he will be happy to oblige also mahmoud the waiter he will get you a table each night with a smile . We will back at the hotel again if only to see abdullah again thanks to you all for a lovely holiday
reviews.title: Lovely time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we booked this hotel just 4 days before travelling & we were very happy with our choice.
reviews.title: An excellent week

reviews.text: The only critisism was that our bathroom, although spotless was in need of redecoration as the tiles were chipped etc. (we were in the older part of the hotel) We were offered an upgrade for a charge but chose to stay put.
reviews.title: Mixed Feelings...

reviews.text: Everything else was great & the staff were very helpful & friendly.
reviews.title: great return
Excellent winter break
reviews.text: We picked this hotel due to the great reviews on this website. Because of the reports that the rooms (especially bathrooms) in the main building are a bit tired, I e-mailed the hotel in advance and requested that my husband & I be allocated a room in the new building, which I am pleased to say was accommodated. We had a lovely spacious room with a huge kingsize bed and a walk-in shower. It was very clean and comfortable, although the bathroom grouting could have done with some bleach to clean it up a bit. Our room was cleaned every day with fresh towels and a large bottle of water left each day.

reviews.title: Fantastic value for money and the friendliest staff!
reviews.text: The food is pretty good - I've had better in AI buffet style, but also much worse. Food is always hot enough and you can usually find something you fancy. Breakfast for us was the least good - don't expect a Scottish/English type cooked breakfast. That's fine for us, but I would have liked more choice of cereals and cold meats. You can, though, get freshly cooked omelettes and fried eggs in the BBQ area outside, which is good. Plenty of choice at lunch & dinner and the Egyptian food is pretty good. Choice of 1 soup @ lunchtime and 2 @ dinner, which were always very good and an excellent choice of breads. Only the Pharon buffet restaurant was open, I guess the hotel wasn't busy enough to open the Atrium - it would have been good to have had a choice of buffet restaurant for a change.

reviews.title: kiroseiz
reviews.text: The majority of the staff are great and so helpful (with the exception of one, who I won't name - don't want him to get into trouble). Particular thanks to Azaz and Azr, who looked after us very well. Our only complaint about the restaurant was the wine service - very small glasses and just a dribble at the bottom. We asked for a reasonable glass of wine, but were told that they weren't allowed to do that - it is so stupid, we were constantly trying to attract the waiters' attention to get refills. They work really hard as it is, and this just gives them even more work. I would suggest they either provide better sized glasses (and fill them properly), or provide carafes/half carafes or even self service. We enjoy wine with our meal and this did spoil things somewhat.

reviews.title: Best holiday in along time
reviews.text: We went to the Indian restaurant, Bukhara, one night and it was excellent. Great service and lovely, freshly cooked food - and lots of it! You can still get AI drinks, and AI guests get LE30 each discount so meal for the 2 of us was only about £30. It was a pity we didn't have much money to spend as we'd have gone to Nathans one night, and the Dolce Vita as well to have a change of venue and you feel as though you're going out for dinner rather than just having something to eat.

reviews.title: A MUST DO!
reviews.text: The grounds and pool areas are pristine, and again the staff are great. 3 pools to choose from and no problem getting sun loungers. Great big parasols, which the pool attendants will help to put up if you're having difficulty. Particular thanks to Emad at the quiet pool/Waves Bar - what a lovely guy, and he made everyone great cocktails. The only annoyance, was as has been said by many reviewers, the constant disruption of people trying to get you to go to the spa/beauty centre. The girl who came round the pools was particularly annoying and would not always take no for an answer. Also, people coming round trying to get you go to the a la carte restaurants was a bit annoying.
Just returned from our week stay in kiroseiz resort and was very impressed with the whole experience.
reviews.title: Value for money with great staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We normally won't stay anywhere less than 5* in egypt however we were highly recommend this hotel through friends. For the price we payed and the service we received I would recommend this resort to a friend to.
reviews.title: fantastic holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel room was a little tired and bathroom could do with a little more attention to detail when cleaning however this was the only downfall.
reviews.title: Great Holiday......can't wait to return

reviews.text: We stayed around the quiet pool everyday because the entertainment pool is not our thing even though everyone at the other pools seem to be having real good fun, our barman around the quiet pool bar was Emad, he was a fantastic barman and was over to our sunbeds on a regular basis keeping our drinks topped up and even making us special cocktails, he really is a lovely man and a fantastic barman.
reviews.title: Exellent holliday, Xperience kiroseiz parkland

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also visited the Indian and Italian restaurants a number of times during our stay, our waiter Joseph in the indian restaurant was again fantastic, very helpful and always has a smile on his face. It's service like this that makes your stay more special.
reviews.title: good hotel xperience kiroseiz parkland
The staff really made our holiday great...!
reviews.text: Booked as a "late break" to have a week of no kids. Last time we stayed at the Hilton Sharks Bay and it was lovely, but was expensive especially for just a quick week away. We chose this hotel after reading a review in here instead.

reviews.title: family holiday
reviews.text: We're REALLY glad we did..!

reviews.title: Do not be worried about visiting Sharm El Sheikh
reviews.text: THE ROOMS

reviews.title: Yet another great week at the Kiroseiz
reviews.text: The rooms are not the most modern, but they are clean and tidy. The bathrooms look a little "dated" but again are clean. All we were looking for.

reviews.title: Brilliant staff, fantastic value would reccomend to anyone to go here, absolutly loved every minute
reviews.text: THE LOCATION
